result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 08:27 AM Defendant Amanda J Skirko in court with attorney Thomas J Marola.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Menomonee Falls Police Officer Drew Hildenbrand sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Thurston.  Cross examination by Attorney Marola.  State rests.  State moves for bind over without argument.  Attorney Marola objects to bind over with argument and moves to dismiss.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 11, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:04 AM Defendant Amanda J Skirko in court with attorney Thomas J Marola.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Marola previously filed a motion to dismiss.  Attorney Marola makes arguments in support of his motion.  The State responds to Attorney Marola's motion.  Attorney Marola further argues his motion.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court will deny the motion to dismiss.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:15 am.
filed by Atty. Thomas Marola

10:00 AM Defendant Amanda J Skirko in court with attorney Thomas J Marola.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Marola requests to address the complaint, moving to dismiss and presents arguments.  State is not in receipt of a motion challenging the four corners.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court will set for a Motion to Dismiss and defense to file a motion prior to the next date.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
filed by Attorney Thomas Marola

02:00 PM Defendant Amanda J Skirko in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.    Attorney appears as friend of the court. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.
